results.title: The City of women = La Citta delle donne
results.creator_credit: Opera Film Produzione, Gaumont-British Instructional and Federico Fellini
results.brief_description: When Snaporaz (Marcello Mastroianni) follows an attractive woman off a train she leads him into the midst of a feminist seminar. So begins a fantastic journey as Mastroianni’s Don Juan finds himself meeting a bizarre coterie of female characters. In “La citta delle donne” Fellini confronts feminism in all its guises. Fellini is at once self-critical and indulgent but, as usual, his wonderful sense of fantasy makes this an enjoyable film to watch. In Italian with English subtitles. Note:During last 10 minutes of film some white lines may appear on screen. Adjust tracking on video player.

results.title: The City of the dead = Horror hotel
results.creator_credit: Vulcan Film (UK), Donald Taylor and John Moxey
results.brief_description: A young college student, intrigued by the historical practices of witchcraft conducted in the 17th century, travels to a small town for further investigation. There she meets a mysterious end, leaving her brother and boyfriend to uncover the truth about the town’s malevolent inhabitants. Filmed in black and white, and released the same year as Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, this horror tale is suitably menacing, relying very little on special effects, but more on atmosphere and a chilling narrative. Also known as “Horror hotel”.

results.title: The City of lost children [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Lumière, Studio Canal+, France 3 Cinema, Claudie Ossard, Marc Caro and Jean-Pierre Jeunet
results.brief_description: An extraordinary film from the makers of “Delicatessen”. Krank lives on a lonely oil rig in a swirling sea. He cannot dream and is aging prematurely so he kidnaps young children hoping to steal their sleeping thoughts. On a quest to find his young brother, a fairground strongman called One sets off on a series of fantastical adventures to rescue the lost children.

results.title: The City of Chromatic Dissolution
results.brief_description: In three-colour separation studies of the CBD of Melbourne shot in 1986 on very outdated rolls of Ilford Pan F black-and-white negative, evidence of chemical dissolution appears as cyan, magenta and yellow spots on the colour prints.

constellations_other.name: Communicating colour
constellations_other.description: An exploration of colour on-screen inspired by Technicolor supervisor, Natalie Kalmus.

results.description: In three-colour separation studies of the CBD of Melbourne shot in 1986 on very outdated rolls of Ilford Pan F black and white negative, evidence of chemical dissolution appears as cyan, magenta and yellow spots on the colour prints. The other ‘dissolution’ - the 3-colour separation and reconstitution of the colour of the image - shows in the pedestrian and motor traffic activity, and also in the mirror-facaded ‘invisible’ office buildings in St Kilda Road. The film is accompanied by layers of city sounds and electronically altered bowed glass effects.

results.title: The City of Adelaide
results.brief_description: Provides a survey of Adelaide, with reference to its history, buildings, primary and secondary industries, transport, port facilities, public utilities and recreational and cultural amenities.

results.title: The City changes
results.creator_credit: BFA Educational Media and Andrew Janczak
results.brief_description: As people’s needs change, cities must grow and change to meet these needs. Some changes are obvious; others are subtle. How do they affect people? Can all changes be considered improvements? Designed with minimum narration - and open-ended - allows students to observe and analyze reasons for change and to determine the degree to which the community can or should exercise control over change.

results.title: The City and the self
results.brief_description: Presents a study of human relations in the city based on psychological concepts formulated by Professor Stanley Milgram. Examines the city dwellers’ perception of their city and their behavior in created situations.

results.title: The City's edge
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, CB Films (France), Oliver Sullivan Productions, Pom Oliver, Errol Sullivan and Ken Quinnell
results.brief_description: A dramatic contemporary love story of an aspiring young writer from the country and an urban woman struggling against the guilt of her first sexual experiences. They become involved with each other, their pasts and a frightening narrow world that is dominated by a charismatic young Aborigine who is driven by a contempt for life and a fierce hatred of white Australian society. Starring Hugo Weaving, Tommy Lewis, Shirley Cameron and Mark Lee. Co-starring Ralph Cotterill, Julie McGregor, Frederic Abbott, Martin Harris and Katrina Foster. Based on the novel by W. A. Harbinson.

results.title: The City
results.creator_credit: American Documentary Films, Falph Steiner and Willard Van Dyke
results.brief_description: An indictment of unplanned city growth and uncontrolled expansion of industry, this is one of America’s best documentary films, famous for its “eating sequence”. The film has three distinct sections: first, the early pastoral life of the American colonies; the chaotic and industrialised metropolis, the sprawling contrasting city, the dirt, poverty, ill health and despair of the victims of the industrial city’s haphazard growth; the necessity for planned city growth. Based on Lewis Mumford’s book, “The Culture of Cities”, this film owes much of its punch to the editing of well-chosen details, excellently photographed, enabling the film to argue visually.

results.title: The Citizen rebels = Il cittadino si ribella
results.brief_description: Carlo, a self-employed industrial engineer is held at gunpoint by a gang of hoodlums while he is queueing at the local post office. In a struggle to conceal his money from the thugs he is beaten senseless, abducted, and left for dead in their abandoned getaway vehicle. When the local police fail to act on his behalf, Carlo decides to take the matter into his own hands, firstly through his lawyer (who is helpless to assist him), then by his own less legitimate devices. Cast includes Franco Nero and Barbara Bach. In Italian with no English subtitles.
